isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 530 Engine Diagnostic Manual for 4000 Series Trucks (2001) - ENGINE CONTROL SYSTEM OVERVIEW - DIAGNOSTIC SOFTWARE SELF TEST OPERATION

svcsubsecinfo.para: To display ECM Diagnostic Trouble Codes using the EST refer to Diagnostic Testing in Section 5 .
To display ECM Diagnostic Trouble Codes when the EST is not available use the following procedure:

item.para: Set the parking brake and turn the Ignition Key ON.

Press and release the CRUISE ON button and the RESUME/ACCEL button simultaneously. If no faults are present, the cluster odometer will display NO FAULTS. If codes are present they will be flashed out using the red and amber ENGINE lamps on the gauge cluster.

svcsubsecinfo.para: To read the Diagnostic Trouble Codes, count each time the amber ENGINE lamp flashes, continue with the following sequence below. This sequence occurs each time the Cruise Control buttons are depressed together to access the Diagnostic Trouble Codes.

item.para: The red ENGINE lamp will flash once to indicate the beginning of ACTIVE DTC's.
The amber ENGINE lamp will flash repeatedly signaling the Active DTC's.

para.emph: NOTE - All DTC's are three digits. Code 111 indicates no Diagnostic Trouble Codes have been detected.

item.para: Count the flashes in sequence. After each digit of the code a short pause will occur. Three flashes and a pause would indicate number 3. Two flashes, a pause, three flashes, a pause, and two flashes and a pause would indicate Diagnostic Trouble Code 232. If there is more than one DTC, the red ENGINE lamp will flash once indicating the beginning of another active DTC.

svcsubsecinfo.para: After all active DTC's have flashed, the red ENGINE lamp will flash twice to indicate the start of INACTIVE DTC's. Count the flashes from the amber ENGINE lamp. If there is more than one inactive code, the red ENGINE lamp will flash once between each DTC.
After all DTC's have been sent, the red ENGINE lamp will flash three times indicating END OF MESSAGE.

note.para: To repeat DTC transmission, repeat the above procedure by depressing both Cruise Control buttons. The ECM will once again send the stored DTC's.

item.para: Set park brake (required for correct ESC signal and to clear codes).
Turn key switch to the IGN/ON position.
Depress and hold the CRUISE ON and RESUME/ACCEL buttons simultaneously.
Continue holding the Cruise Control buttons. Depress and release the accelerator pedal three (3) times within a six (6) second interval.
